title: Lecture: Jeanne Gang
description:
Architect and MacArthur Fellow Jeanne Gang is the founding principal of Studio Gang, an architecture and urbanism collective in Chicago and New York. Recognized internationally for a design process that foregrounds relationships between individuals, communities, and environments, Studio Gang has produced such award-winning projects as Aqua Tower, the Nature Boardwalk at Lincoln Park Zoo, and Polis Station. The studio is currently engaged in cultural and educational projects across the country and the world—from the new United States Embassy in Brazil to the expansion to the Museum of Natural History in New York and consolidated campus for the California College of the Arts in San Francisco.

Presented as part of the Mitchell Lecture Series, in cooperation with the School of the Art Institute of Chicago
